to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to
Jirmejah, the name of eight or nine Israelites
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

an opening, i.e. door or gate
to droop; by implication to be sick, to mourn
to be ashy, i.e. darkcolored; by implication, to mourn (in sackcloth or sordid garments)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative

little; (in number) few; (in age) young, (in value) ignoble
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
properly, to wound; but only figuratively, to taunt or insult
to cover; by implication, to veil, to encase, protect
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
bareness; concretely, a bare hill or plain
to inhale eagerly; figuratively, to cover; by implication, to be angry; also to hasten

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that

(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn

properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:

properly, a guest; by implication, a foreigner

to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
to stop (usually over night); by implication, to stay permanently; hence (in a bad sense) to be obstinate (especially in words, to complain)
